plan: First, I'll test conservative approaches like bidding half of my value. Then I'll try more aggressive strategies such as bidding my maximum value. I'll also take into account bidding behaviours of Betty and Charles, to use strategic bids slightly over theirs if I notice a pattern. Additionally, if I'm consistently winning, I might take risk to bid low for data purposes, as 'the second-highest bid pay' system could encourage low bidding. Insights from each round will facilitate decision making for future bids, aiming for long-term profit maximization.

I plan to first explore the auction data, observing patterns and competitors' behaviors. I'll test moderately aggressive bids (around 40%-60% of my value), then higher range (70%-90%). I will apply riskier strategies, bidding close to or at the value occasionally to test the results. Depending on outcomes, I'll adjust my bidding strategy accordingly. This plan allows me to gather a broad set of data which will help maximize profits in the long run.

I will begin with a cautious strategy, placing a bid slightly below my value to understand competitive landscape. Next, I'll experiment with bolder moves, such as bidding at maximum allowed to assess risk vs reward. I'll gather data on winners, their winning bids, and profit to optimize my strategy. Gradually, I'll employ a value-based approach; if high value, I'll bid aggressively, while for lower values, I'll bid conservatively. This way, I'll balance risk with potentially high rewards.

Next, I'll increase my bid amount to a more aggressive range, 60-80% of my value. However, if I feel confident about winning, I might bid just above the previous second highest bid. I'll also keep observing Betty and Charles' bid patterns.

I plan to test bidding 50% of my value to assess Andy and Charles' deviations, while avoiding excessive risk. If successful, I'll gradually increase my bid percentage to learn more about their bidding behaviour and to optimize my long-term profits.

Next, I'll test two strategies: a high-risk aggressive bid and a low-risk cautious bid. I'll place a maximum bid when my value is high, and bid considerably lower when it's moderate or low, aiming to maximize potential gains while mitigating losses.

I'll continue exploring aggressive bids, looking between 60-80% of my value. If patterns emerge from Betty or Charles' bids, I'll place my bid slightly higher than theirs for a possible win at lower cost.

Next, I plan to increase my bid to around 70% of my value, testing the higher-risk strategy. If unsuccessful, I will alternate between moderate and low bids in subsequent rounds, seeking optimal balance between risk and profit.

I will refine my strategy to test aggressive and moderate bids. When my value is extremely high, I'll bid aggressively, close to the maximum. For moderate or low values, I'll opt for much lower, more cautious bids to mitigate losses while still exploring competition.

I will explore aggressive bids within 70-90% of my value. If patterns emerge in Betty/Charles bids, I'll slightly exceed them for low-cost wins. Ramping up risks could yield helpful data for later rounds without compromising long-term profit potential.

Test bidding 80% of my value, pushing the higher-risk strategy. If unsuccessful, use that data to optimize a strategy alternating between mid-range and low bids, considering competitors' pattern and potential profit.

I plan to incorporate strategic bidding techniques based on my value. I'll bid aggressively close to my value for high values. For moderate or low values, I will bid conservatively below value to preserve profit, and to evaluate contested bids scenario.

I'll test aggressive strategies, bidding 70-90% of value. Simultaneously, I'll try strategic bids slightly above Betty and Charles' if patterns emerge. Lower bids may be used when in winning positions to gather data, optimizing long-term profit maximization.

Next, I'll explore aggressive bids, aiming closer to my full value (90-100%). By testing this risky range, I can assess the potential payoff and better adapt my strategy, considering the previous round revelations and competitors' behavior.

Next, I'll bid my exact value during high-value incidents, while attempting lower bids for moderate or lesser values. I'll also occasionally overbid despite negative profit to gather more data and outcomes. This mix of aggressive and cautious strategy will maximize profits and gather diverse risk benchmarks.

I'll bid up to 80-100% of my value to test more risky strategies. Also, if patterns in other bidders' behavior emerge, I aim to place strategic bids slightly above them. Additionally, I might bid lower when winning consistently for data gathering.

I plan to mix aggressive and cautious strategies, alternating between bidding 70-90% of my value (high-risk) and 30-50% (low-risk). I'll adjust bid percentages based on competitors' behavior and the success of each strategy, aiming to maximize long-term profits.

I'll apply a flexible strategy, making bold bids for high values, while adopting conservative bids for lower values. Occasionally, I'll overbid on lower values to test competitors' responses. I will apply insights from each round to optimize my future bids, aiming to increase profit margins.

Next rounds will involve testing the entire spectrum of bidding: minimum, maximum and 50%-75% of my value. Depending on observed bidding patterns of Betty and Charles, I may override these strategies to make a strategic bid slightly above theirs.

Next, I aim to explore ranges between 30-50% and 70-90% of my value. Alternating between these risk levels, I can evaluate effectiveness of each and adjust bid dynamically, factoring in competitors' strategies and susceptibilities, optimizing for long-term profit maximization.

I'll continue modifying my strategy per the value; high values will see aggressive bids, whilst for lower values I'll go conservative. I'll also explore the effects of the occasional overbid. If others persistently bid low, my gains might improve through lower bids, even on high values.

Next, I'll explore bidding nearly full value, especially when it's high. Additionally, pending on Betty and Charles' tendencies, I'll consider outbidding them strategically. This aggressive strategy aims towards maximizing long-term profits and gathering significant data for price points analysis.

Next, I'll adapt my bidding to around 65-70% of my value. Depending on competitors' strategies, I may slightly increase or decrease my bids, aiming to strike an ideal balance between risk and potential reward to maximize long-term profits.

I will continue bidding slightly less than my high values while cautious on lower values to maintain profits. I'll also experiment with lower than usual bids on high values, to test the responses of other bidders when lower bids are placed.

For upcoming rounds, I'll keep exploring aggressive bids up to 100% of my value while also tracking Betty and Charles' patterns, placing my bid slightly higher than theirs strategically. For high values, I may bid full sums to maximise potential profit, given the risk-reward balance.

I will test a wider spectrum of bids, targeting 30%-70%, then 70%-100% of my value. I'll record bid results and behaviors displayed by Andy and Charles, optimally adjusting my strategy based on data accumulated, to balance risk and maximize long-term earnings.

I will experiment with bidding down by $20-$30 from my value in high value scenarios. For low values, I will adopt a conservative strategy. I'll aim to balance potential gains with risks, learning from previous bidding patterns to optimize my strategy and maximize profits.

I'll bid 75-100% of my value to explore aggressive strategy. I also plan to observe Betty and Charles' bidding patterns, aiming to place strategic bids slightly above theirs. This approach looks to maximize long-term profits by balancing risky bids with strategic play.

Based on previous rounds, I plan to escalate my bidding strategy with more risk, targeting 70-100% of my value. By modulating bids within this range according to competitors' behavior, I aim to balance potential profitability and risk, continuously refining strategy for maximum long-term gains.

I'll place aggressive bids for very high values, while lowering bids by 15%-20% on moderate values to maximize profit. For low values, I'll bid cautiously. Additionally, I'll overbid infrequently to gauge responses and adapt strategies accordingly to gain insights and optimize results.

In the upcoming rounds, I'll aim for strategic bids slightly over Betty or Charles' given their patterns. When my value is high, I'll consider bidding the full amount. The dynamic approach will balance aggressive bids with exploration of data points and the potential for strategic play.

I'll adopt a varied strategy, bidding 45%-55% of my value in lower-value rounds, and 70%-90% in rounds where my value is high. I will adapt dynamically to competitors' patterns to balance caution and boldness, optimizing my profit over multiple auction rounds.

I'll apply a mixture of aggressive and conservative bidding. I'll bid high for peak values, moderate for average values, less for low values. I'll occasionally overbid on low values to gauge other bidders' reactions and strategically adapt my bidding approach to maximize long-term profitability.

I will experiment with lower strategic bids based on others' patterns, especially when previous bids drastically lower. Contemplating full bids when potential profit is substantial. Continue tracking Betty and Charles' behaviours to adjust strategies and maximize profit.

I'll test bidding 30-40% of my value in low-value rounds, 60-70% in moderate-value, and 70-90% when my value is high. Will adjust bids according to trends observed, targeting optimal balance between risk and profit maximization.

I'll employ varying strategies per value - aggressive for high, moderate for mid-level, and conservative for low values. On high values, I'll lower bid by 30-40% to see if there's any advantage. I'll occasionally place an overbid on low values to explore reactions of other bidders.

Next, I'll explore bidding slightly below actual value, but still higher than Betty and Charles' typical bids. I'll also test bidding full value if it's high. Tracking their patterns helps to dynamically adjust strategies, aiming for strategic wins and data exploration.

Consider testing further within 30-50% and 70-90% bid ranges, oscillating between these based on round values. Refine strategy based on observed competitor bidding patterns, aiming to strike optimal balance between risk and reward for long-term profit maximization.

I'll adopt a flexible strategy based on profit optimization. For high values, I'll bid near the value, while for medium and low, I'll lower bids by 15-25%. Occasionally, overbidding on low values will gauge competitors' thresholds, aiding in refining and diversifying my bidding strategies.

Next, I'll test lower bidding strategies while still remaining competitive. This includes trying a conservative strategy of bidding around 50% of my value. I'll also continue observing Betty and Charles' patterns with my responses being dynamically adjusted according to these trends.

I will aim to bid strategically based on my value, competitors' previous bids, and calculate bids within ranges 30%-60% for low value, 40%-70% for moderate value, and 80%-100% for high-value rounds, thereby balancing risks and maximizing profits.

I'll evaluate the competition's bidding habits, apply aggressive bids on high values while moderately lowering bids on average values. Rarely, I will overbid on low values. The aim is to balance potential profit maximization with risk management and learning from the competitors' strategies.

I'll continue exploring the full range of bidding from conservative to aggressive based on valuation. Monitoring opposition patterns, I'll aim for strategic bids slightly above theirs. If I've been winning consistently, an occasional low bid could help gather data, aiding long-term profit maximization.

Next, I'll incorporate higher-risk strategies, exploring bids within 70%-100% of value during high-value rounds, while reserving lower bids (30%-60%) for low-value rounds, adjusting dynamically based on observed competitor actions to maximize long-term profits.

I'll adjust my strategy by lowering high-value bids closer to second highest bids when possible. Furthermore, I'll maintain conservative bids on moderate to low values. For data gathering, I'll occasionally overbid on low values and monitor other bidder reactions to diversify my strategies.
